page.title: 01ST.BREOCK DOWNS:FARMLAND
page.content: This D block is beautiful{downland with long rolling hills that descend in{south-facing coombes}to the valley known as St.Wenn valley.The highest point reaches 700 feet and is still {unenclosed}land.It is rich farm land and is used to raise sheep and cattle. One part is called{Lantuel}which means literally translated{"God's Acre".}An apt description of beautiful scenery. { Pre-historic}man has left five large {tumuli or burial chambers}are visible and there are two prominent{standing {stones.}The larger,western long stone is known as{Mena Gurtha -the Waiting {Stone.}The name is medieval. Traders used to gather here to clinch deals. Since the time of the enclosures little has changed.Only three roads traverse the whole area.Recently one farm at Hustyn Gate has become a {Health Farm.
